metadata.commander_name: Major-General Ashton Gerard Oswald Mosley Mayne

narrative.title: 5Th Indian Division - 1941Q2
narrative.situation: British Infantry Division (Indian Army) deployed in North Africa during 1941Q2.
narrative.objectives: Standard Indian Army infantry division - all-arms formation capable of independent operations. In East Africa: siege warfare, mountain assault, pursuit operations. After June 1941: retraining for Western Desert mobile warfare.
narrative.axis_objective: Hold current positions and prevent Allied breakthrough.
narrative.allied_objective: Advance and neutralize Axis defensive positions.

weather.terrain: Eritrean highlands - mountainous terrain (2,000-3,500m altitude), rocky escarpments, limited roads, defensive positions on mountain strongpoints

air_support.note: No theater air summary available for this quarter

special_rules: Mixed British-Indian battalions (1 British + 2 Indian per brigade)
Extreme climate adaptation (tropical East Africa to desert Egypt)

environment.terrain_type: Eritrean highlands - mountainous terrain (2,000-3,500m altitude), rocky escarpments, limited roads, defensive positions on mountain strongpoints
